column5: Those are some really cool perch videos Terry.  Nice Simcoe perch report.  There was about 5" of ice out from Gilford, and many ATV's and sleds out on the safe ice.  It's about time!  Aaron
Herring are closed year round on Simcoe, so I hope they didnt literally go in the box.

every time squid42(calamari1965) posts it's stuff like that...the person behind the name seems to get off on posts like that, I'm sure he/she/it wasn't even fishing..so don't worry about that .....but I could be wrong...lol
Thanks for the report Terry.  We went out again today, to Innisfil this time, no luck again  Oh well, there's always next weekend  Joey
I hope your endangered herring were good.
great videos Terry.  I've got a camera as well and let me tell you it seriously cuts into my fishing time!  Too fun just to watch.

Nice report bud.  The bike looks just great the way you have it set up and all.  I stayed local this weekend. I had to work on my conditioning ,walking up and down hills   .  No fish,but you learn how to walk fast when you hear cracking under yer feet  becarefull out there folks. One more week of these cold temps should make it alot safer.  Thanks for sharing
well you got on the ice that's the important thing... I think I need to work on my conditioning but not while wearing my winter boots
Great report and awesome videos!  The more ice reports I see, the more I'm slowly inching towards giving it a try....been on the fence for a while now...hehe.
Correct me if Im wrong, but I thought Herring was a no no ? ......sorry, posted Question before I read the rest of the thread.....got my answer thanks!!
Very nice report. The videos really are a nice addition.  Thanks for post.  cheers,  ehg

Wow,what a cool toy! There sure were lots of perch there. You'd think they'd be hungry. Looking at all those perch swimming around ...........hmm, it's making me hungry. MMMM,Cove Room .............. Dover..........perch.

well got up and saw freezing rain there were reports of bad roads so I waited till 745 before I headed out most roads were pretty good, found a parking spot on the road, could see there were cars and trucks parked on the lake..and off I went     there was a plowed road out to the first hut, so someone had a truck out there...I stop near some huts set up dropped the camera and started looking for perch..didn't see any but did see 2 bass....a little early for them so I packed up and moved across the lake to gilford...oh first thing I did even before I got anything off the ATV..broke my good icefishing rod....figures I would think 1000s of people out there..and blue clam portable fish huts.tons of them, I should have bought stock in the company  hope it's big enough to see all the people      I set up and saw perch on the camera right away     they were not very big..but lots of them  here are some movie clips of them swimming around and some hook ups  movie    movie 2  movie 3  movie4 real busy playing with the aquavu..didn't even try my new fishfinder.....   well had a good time everything seems to be working ok can't wait to get out again
surprised to see vehicles on the ice .We were out Tue afternoon on 5" of ice.Off Gilford in front of Kon Tiki.  How was the bite ? we had very little luck. Hope to be out one morning this week.
I caught lots of 7 to 9 inch Jumbos today. North of there. Caught a few herring to add to the box as well.
well I was just using plastic if I had live bait, I think I would have/could have caught lots,,I was too busy playing with the camera
Nice Vids!
Thanks Terry.  I wonder if there are any bigger ones around there?
we HAD live bait and did just as well!
Thanks for the report Terry. Glad to see you made it out there. I'm still hoping to make it out there some time.  dsn
great report and nice video's, thanks for posting.
Nice videos man, might have seen you out there lol
very cool vids

Thanks for posting the pics and the vids, Terry.  Good on ya gettin' out there.  I was out at Valens Reservior in Cambridge today and tried for some bluegills but the bite was almost non-existant.  Might give Cooks a go tomorrow though.  Cheers!

well terry looks like they were sure interested in your bait and your camera,cool vids thanks for the report and movies hope you get some bigger ones next time  and it sure looked very busy out there today  tons of huts & people
Hey, great vid's Terry, glad you finally got out on the ice.

Very nice terry ! I think I may have seen you out there when we arrived at our first spot of the day....I recognize that yellow bag on your quad....  But who know really...so many quads on the ice today !
Nice work there Terry, that camera sure works like a dream. Are using florocarbon leader cause you can't even see your line to your jig. Anyways great videos and pics  Rob C
Nice report Terry. Looks like a fun day.
WTG Terry.  Great report.
wow awesome videos!  I enjoyed them alot!
Nice vids Terry: maybe we should buy some stocks for Aqua-vu!
WTG Terry... We were off bp today, not much luck, but fish were around...  thx for the report and videos... we were wondering how cooks bay was holding up today...
Cool vids.. thanks for posting!
seems like just about everyone was on simcoe this weekend
Great report and pics Terry. Thanks
ummm...you're not allowed to keep herring from simcoe
